title: Problems with pulseaudio
content: Since years I've a reliable running configuration (Ubuntu 22.04 LTS up to date). I#m using MPD in user mode to listen radio streams. Since the last update of Thunderbird (115.4.1 64-Bit) the start of thunderbird crashes pulseaudio. Everytime Thunderbird is started there is an ugly sound from speaker and the running radio stream is interrupted. Here are the log lines from MPD player from that event: ``` Nov 19 10:22 : output: Failed to play on "Pulse-Audio" (pulse): disconnected Nov 19 10:22 : exception: Failed to open audio output ``` I've to choose my station again, then MPD will play again program. But I guess it is not a MPD issue at least but something between Thunderbird and Pulseaudio is wrong. Does anybody has an idea whrer to serch or which logs could tell more?
creator: joerg.zywek

title: How to use a filter on subject 'contains' part of a word ie not whole word
content:
I'm trying to filter out junk phishing emails from the Temu company.

Every email comes from a different email address, probably farmed, and every subject line is different but usually has temu or Temu in it somewhere. eg TemuDelivery, Your Temu_pallet, temu_ arriving soon

I've set up filters to delete the message if the subject 'contains' temu but that only seems to work if the subject has temu as a word on its own and in lower case. So I set up other ones looking for Temu_ temu_ TemuDelivery etc.

Is there way to filter on just a string of characters in the subject line instead of looking for whole words as it seems to do?

i.e. delete the message if the subject contains temu in upper, lower or camel case and whether or not there are other non white space characters before or after it?

I do have junk training on but that is taking a long time since these are sort of 'genuine' emails sent from hundreds of different genuine email address and so the headers don't seem to indicate a high spam count.
creator: hmonline1

title: Thunderbird stopped getting emails for all of my accounts. The same for my wife's computer
content:
As of the morning of Nov 16th, my Thunderbird has stopped getting emails for all of my accounts. The same for my wife's computer. Was there some sort of Windows update that locked things from connecting? It is not my email servers as they all work on my phone.

When I select "Get Messages" the blue bar in the lower right corner is up for a minute, goes away and no messages. It will let me send messages.

I also tried to completely uninstall Thunderbird, it indicated all information removed. Downloaded 115.4.3, installed, started and the exact same Thunderbird came up, complete with all of my emails. Obviously different definition of ALL.

title: Email threads

title: Response often  very slow - post upgrade
content:
Since the UI upgrade, my Thunderbird client has become slow on my PC. On opening instead of what was previously a quick start-up to my INBOX, it now hangs and you can see (from bottom left) its polling out to email servers and waiting for a response .... much slower than previously.

It's not a server response as I use same email on my iPad and that logs in with almost zero delay.

Occasionally also lags behind key board, you are typing and you are several characters or even words in front of the client.

Is there any rebuild or similar I should do now I am on the 'new look'
creator: rick_hughes

title: Thunderbird quitting and duplicating messages in Trash
content: I have recently started using Thunderbird 115.4.3 on a new laptop running Windows 11. I transferred my profile from my old laptop and set up my two email accounts as POP accounts. The problem is that Tbird is regularly crashing, mostly (maybe only?) when I delete messages from my Inbox. When I restart the program, it works fine except that all or most of the messages in Trash are now duplicated multiple times. Any ideas how to stop this behavior?
creator: levysantacruz

title: How can we stop it: whenever my wife starts TB, Mozilla downloads the same Privacy Message to a new tab in TB
content:
The Mozilla message explains your privacy and has "Dodnload Firefox" box; my wife has dozens! of them in identical tabs because she sometimes forgets to close them eaach time she uses TB.

They arrive every time she starts TB on Windows 10. They pile up unless she remembers to delete each one. She's running a Dell inspiron, Apart from this problem, all seems fine--she has the latest versions of both TB and Firefox, an IMAP connection to hotmail that works great. This didn't happen until the last month or so, she esimates.

How can we stop this? Her TB does accept cookies, but that won't stop these messages. I can't find a setting that affects this behavior.

The constant repeat messages are driving her crazy. Surely there is a way to stop them?
creator: kmartinp

title: Thunderbird : Sorting by date when changing mailboxes
content:
Using Thunderbird 115.4.1 under Kubuntu Linux. Everything works well except for one minor irritation that might be just a setting - but I can't find it! The mail is set to show in ascending date order and is unthreaded and in table format, if I scroll to the most recent mail at the bottom of the list it displays fine. However, I have 11 mailboxes and if I switch between them, although the mail is still in ascending order, the mail selected is not the last on the list, in fact it could be hundreds of emails earlier than the last one. I have set each mailbox to show in ascending order and there are no extensions installed. Having to scroll to the end of each mailbox as I switch between them every time is a time waster. Just a guess, is there an index to the selected position in the table that isn't being preserved as mailboxes are switched? It would be nice if the most recently received mail was always selected when the mailbox is opened.

Brian.
creator: brian310

I have attached a screen shot and can provide others as required. I am a volunteer for Balance & Dizziness Canada and some of the folders I need to export to Thunderbird have a lot of emails and are important for me to have available to refer back to. Many thanks for any help you can provide.

- Andrea Wilson, Webmaster, Balance & Dizziness Canada [removed site]

title: Multiple "Drafts" and "Sent" folders
content:
Hi, Looking at the folders under my email, I see: 1 Inbox, 3 Drafts, 3 Sent, 1 Archive, & 1 Trash. How do I get rid of the extra Drafts and Sent folders? See the image below. The second and third are empty.

Yes :) there is more to it. Here are the details. I know how they got there and I did that to myself. I keep my Thunderbird Profile Data in a MS OneDrive shared folder. Yes, I know, this has some risk. However I work overseas 1/2 the time and use two different computers. This allows me to have each computer on a POP account and still have one set of data (and have Pop Accounts on my phones). I have been doing this for more than a year, and have not had any consequences beyond the above. I understand IMAP accounts, but do not use them for very good reasons, please do not recommend that.

I am generally careful to close T-Bird and then wait for OneDrive to update (I have learned how to "force" OneDrive to do so) before restarting the other one. There have been several occasions where I did not do that. Usually, I just get a bunch of repeated emails and some extra "computer named" versions of the data files. Once in a while, another folder Drafts and Sent folder has appeared.

Thanks in advance.
creator: Derrick9

title: Emails received after moving messages to local folder
content:
I have moved some folders of emails from an imap email account in my Thunderbird client (Supernova) to local folders. I did this by right clicking the folder and selecting 'Move to' and selecting the destination folder in Local Folders. The emails appeared to move successfully.

About a minute after doing this I received two emails from Mimecast saying 'your message couldn't be delivered'. The receipient email it shows is not one I have a record of previously sending to. The email headers show the email appears to have been generated on that day and time with no previous activity, suggesting it is a genuine incoming email.

I am worried that moving the folders of emails to local folders has somehow sent emails out to recipients. Is this possible? Are there logs within Thunderbird that I can check to see exactly what it did during the move process? Unfortunately there is nothing in the headers of the emails I received to suggest what was actually sent to the address.
creator: tward100

title: Syncronizing Thunderbird and Google Calendars
content: Attempting to add birthdates to Thunderbird calendar. Have initialized 'Lightning' and 'Provider for Google' addons. Existing calendars appear to be synced. That is, I can add events in Thunderbird, and they are visible in my Google calendar (and visa versa). Wish to add a new calendar for birthdates using the 'Birthday Calendar' addon. 'Birthday Calendar' displays birthdates pulled from 'Address Book', and has the added desirable feature of calculating/including 'age'. Thunderbird appears to be correctly retrieving birthdates from 'Address Book'. However, these new birthdate calendar entries do not seem to be reflected in my Google calendar. I do not see an option (in Google) to add this calendar. Can someone guide me through the process of connecting this new 'Birthday Calendar' with Google?
creator: Grizz952
